title: Open Channel Management - OpenChannelJunction
description: This entity contains a harmonised description of a generic junction made for open-channel management (raw-water systems). Junction defines a location where the characteristics of the channel changes, two or more channels come together or split apart, amounts of water are abstracted or inserted to the system

position.description: Description of relevant position of a cross section from a reference point (e.g., the most upstream point of the system)

downstream.description: Relationship. A relationship indicating the ID of the downstream entity (channel, junction, spillway, sluice gate)

upstream.description: Relationship. A relationship indicating the ID of the upstream entity (channel, junction, spillway, sluice gate)

uniqueName.description: Property. The name of the junction

description.description: Property. An optional text that describes other significant information

waterOutflow.description: Property. Water diverted from the junction to another source. Units:'m^3/s'

waterInflow.description: Property. Water inserted to the junction from another source. Units:'m^3/s'
